dt: {bc}the surface of a planet (such as the earth or Mars)
{bc}the surface of the earth or a particular part of it sometimes as contrasted with the air or sea

dt.t: One person was flown by helicopter and another transported by {wi}ground{/wi} …

dt: {bc}an area used for a particular purpose
{bc}the area around and belonging to a house or other building

dt.t: We toured the {wi}grounds{/wi} of the estate.

dt: {bc}an area of knowledge or special interest

dt.t: He covered a lot of {wi}ground{/wi} in his lecture.

dt: {bc}an area to be won or defended in or as if in battle {dx}see also {dxt|proving ground|proving ground|}{/dx}

dt.t: … the nutrient-rich soil that lies deep in the {wi}ground{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the bottom of a body of water
{bc}a basis for belief, action, or argument
{dx}see also {dxt|common ground|common ground|}, {dxt|middle ground|middle ground|}, {dxt|high ground|high ground|}{/dx}
{bc}an object (such as one made of a wire or metal) that makes an electrical connection with the earth
{bc}a large conducting body (such as the earth) used as a common return for an electric circuit and as an arbitrary zero of potential

dt.t: wallpaper with black diamonds on a white {wi}ground{/wi}

dt: {bc}a football offense utilizing primarily running plays

dt.t: The car has been redesigned {it}from the ground up{/it}.
built the resort {it}from the ground up{/it}

dt: {bc}beyond what is necessary or tolerable {bc}to exhaustion
{bc}in or as if in flight {bc}off to a good start

dt.t: the program never got {it}off the ground{/it}
… might need to make a run for it and go {it}to ground{/it} someplace …

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}grund{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}grunt{/it} ground
shortdef: the surface of a planet (such as the earth or Mars); especially : the surface of the earth or a particular part of it sometimes as contrasted with the air or sea —often used before another noun
an area used for a particular purpose
the area around and belonging to a house or other building

dt: {bc}to provide a reason or justification for

dt.t: our fears about technological change may be well {wi}grounded{/wi}

dt: {bc}to furnish with a foundation of knowledge {bc}{sx|base||}

dt.t: an understanding … that is {wi}grounded{/wi} in fact

dt: {bc}to bring to or place on the ground
{bc}to prohibit from taking part in some usual activities
{bc}to throw (a football) intentionally to the ground to avoid being tackled for a loss

dt.t: The ship {wi}grounded{/wi} on a mud bank.

shortdef: to provide a reason or justification for
to furnish with a foundation of knowledge : base

dt: {bc}reduced to small pieces or a powder by a {d_link|grinding|grind:1} process

shortdef: reduced to small pieces or a powder by a grinding process

dt: {bc}to reduce to powder or small fragments by friction (as in a mill or with the teeth)
{bc}to wear down, polish, or sharpen by friction
{bc}to press together with a rotating motion
{bc}to operate or produce by turning a crank
{bc}to become pulverized, polished, or sharpened by friction
{bc}to move with difficulty or friction especially so as to make a grating noise
{bc}to rotate the hips in an erotic manner

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}grindan{/it}; akin to Latin {it}frendere{/it} to crush, grind
shortdef: to reduce to powder or small fragments by friction (as in a mill or with the teeth)
to wear down, polish, or sharpen by friction
